twist_to_motors.py

1 #!/usr/bin/env python
2 """
3  twist_to_motors - converts a twist message to motor commands. Needed for navigation stack
4 
5 
6  Copyright (C) 2012 Jon Stephan.

19 
20 import rospy
21 # import roslib
22 from std_msgs.msg import Float64
23 # from rospy_tutorials.msg import Floats
24 # from std_msgs.msg import Int32MultiArray
25 from geometry_msgs.msg import Twist
26 
27 # mapping -1, 1 (m/s) to -200, 200
28 from numpy import interp
29 
30 
32 
33 
34 class TwistToMotors(object):
35 
37 
38 
39  def __init__(self):
40 
41  rospy.init_node("twist_to_motors")
42  nodename = rospy.get_name()
43  rospy.loginfo("%s started" % nodename)
44 
45  # what func to call when ctrl-c is pressed
46  rospy.on_shutdown(self.shutdown)
47 
48  self.L = rospy.get_param("wheel_separation", 0.15)
49  self.R = rospy.get_param("wheel_radius", 0.035)
50  # 20ms
51  self.rate = rospy.get_param("rate", 50)
52 
53  # self.pub_lmotor = rospy.Publisher('lwheel_vtarget', Float64, queue_size=10)
54  # pub to h/w interface. the topic name must match with yaml and launch files.
55  self.pub_rmotor = rospy.Publisher(
56  '/single_joint_actuator/joint1_velocity_controller/command', Float64, queue_size=10)
57  self.pub_lmotor = rospy.Publisher(
58  '/single_joint_actuator/lwheel/command', Float64, queue_size=10)
59 
60  # rospy.Subscriber('twist', Twist, self.twistCallback)
61  rospy.Subscriber('/cmd_vel', Twist, self.twistCallback)
62 
63  self.timeout_ticks = rospy.get_param("~timeout_ticks", 2)
64  self.left = self.left_mapped = 0
65  self.right = self.right_mapped = 0
66  self.motor_speed = {}
67 
68 
69  def spin(self):
70 
71 
72  r = rospy.Rate(self.rate)
73  idle = rospy.Rate(10)
74  then = rospy.Time.now()
75  self.ticks_since_target = self.timeout_ticks
76 
77 
78  while not rospy.is_shutdown():
79 
80  while not rospy.is_shutdown() and self.ticks_since_target < self.timeout_ticks:
81  self.spinOnce()
82  r.sleep()
83  idle.sleep()
84 
85 
86  def spinOnce(self):
87 
88 
89  # dx = (l + r) / 2
90  # dr = (r - l) / w
91 
92  # the unit of self.right is rad/s
93  self.right = (2.0*self.dx + self.dr*self.L)/(2.0*self.R)
94  self.left = (2.0*self.dx - self.dr*self.L)/(2.0*self.R)
95  # rospy.loginfo("publishing: (%5.2f, %5.2f)", self.left, self.right)
96 
97  # mapping makes tunning pid coefficents easier (note: map radius/s instead of m/s)
98  #self.right = interp(self.right, [-15, 15], [-255, 250])
99  #self.left = interp(self.left, [-15, 15], [-255, 250])
100 
101  """
102  if(self.left_mapped < 0 and self.right_mapped > 0):
103  self.motor_speed = [49, self.right_mapped]
104  elif(self.left_mapped > 0 and self.right_mapped < 0):
105  self.motor_speed = [self.left_mapped, 49]
106  else:
107  self.motor_speed = [self.left_mapped, self.right_mapped]
108 
109  self.pub_rmotor.publish(self.motor_speed[0])
110  self.pub_lmotor.publish(self.motor_speed[1])
111  """
112 
113  self.pub_lmotor.publish(self.left)
114  self.pub_rmotor.publish(self.right)
115 
116  self.ticks_since_target += 1
117 
118 
119  def twistCallback(self,msg):
120 
122  self.ticks_since_target = 0
123  self.dx = msg.linear.x
124  self.dr = msg.angular.z
125  self.dy = msg.linear.y
126 
127  def shutdown(self):
128  rospy.loginfo("Stop roachBot")
129  #self.motor_speed = [0,0]
130  self.pub_rmotor.publish(0.0)
131  self.pub_lmotor.publish(0.0)
132  # makes sure robot receive the stop cmd prior to shutting down
133  rospy.sleep(1)
134 
135 
137 if __name__ == '__main__':
138  """ main """
139  try:
140  twistToMotors = TwistToMotors()
141  twistToMotors.spin()
142  except rospy.ROSInterruptException:
143  pass
